channel.title: How do I edit the XP rates in my server?

item.title: How do I edit the XP rates in my server?
item.dc:creator: @Ddragonimp Ddragonimp
item.description:
@Ddragonimp wrote:

Delta’s code is under
client.java ]

Spell…

		if (rune1 != -1) // fixed delete bug -bakatool
			deleteItem(rune1, getItemSlot(rune1), rune1Am);
		if (rune2 != -1) // fixed delete bug -bakatool
			deleteItem(rune2, getItemSlot(rune2), rune2Am);
		if (rune3 != -1) // //fixed delete bug -bakatool
			deleteItem(rune3, getItemSlot(rune3), rune3Am);
		if (rune4 != -1) // //fixed delete bug -bakatool
			deleteItem(rune4, getItemSlot(rune4), rune4Am);
		addSkillXP((spellXP*hitDiff), 6);
		addSkillXP((spellXP*hitDiff / 2), 3);

for Regular Combat

          if (UseBow || UseCrossBow) {
            TotalExp = (double)(400*hitDiff);
            TotalExp = (double)(TotalExp*CombatExpRate);
            addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), 4);
          } else if (FightType != 3) {
            TotalExp = (double)(400*hitDiff);
            TotalExp = (double)(TotalExp*CombatExpRate);
            addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), SkillID);
          } else {
            TotalExp = (double)(80*hitDiff);
            TotalExp = (double)(TotalExp*CombatExpRate);
            addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), playerAttack);
            addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), playerDefence);
            addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), playerStrength);
          }
          TotalExp = (double)(120*hitDiff);
          TotalExp = (double)(TotalExp*CombatExpRate);
          addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), playerHitpoints);
          attackTimer = 7;

Read full topic

item.title: How do I edit the XP rates in my server?

item.description:
@Abandoned_Dreams wrote:

[quote=“username of a dag, post:1, topic:377795”]title.[/quote]If Its Not PI Then Go Into Client.java And Search * Untill You Come Across Something That Says Skill Then It Says The EXP Rate ####…
(Don’t Mess With Delta Much Anymore Sorry)

item.title: How do I edit the XP rates in my server?
item.dc:creator: @deven deven
item.description:
@deven wrote:

If your using a pi Go into Src > Server And click Config.java and it should be in there its a small notepad so shouldnt have any problems finding it
